title: How to Make Nutella Stuffed Croissants

steps.headline: Open and unwrap refrigerated croissant dough.
steps.description: Unroll dough and separate croissant pieces (there should be perforated edges to use as a guide). Lay croissant pieces on a clean, flat surface.

steps.headline: Add 1 tsp.
steps.description: of Nutella to the middle of the croissant piece. Use the spoon to spread the Nutella out into a small square (leaving approximately 1 or 2” from the edge).

steps.headline: Place 5 to 8 mini-marshmallows on top of your Nutella square.
steps.description: Cover the square with marshmallows without overwhelming it.

steps.headline: Fold croissant piece into a triangle.
steps.description: Make sure none of the Nutella or marshmallows ooze from the sides. If they do, remove some of the filling until you have a comfortable fit.

steps.headline: Crimp the edges of the croissant using your fork.
steps.description: Work your way around the folded edges by gently pressing down with the fork tongs to create a crimping pattern.

steps.headline: Bake croissants according to package/manufacturer directions.
steps.description: Marshmallows should melt into the Nutella to create a creamy, chocolaty filling.

text: Open and unwrap refrigerated croissant dough. Unroll dough and separate croissant pieces (there should be perforated edges to use as a guide). Lay croissant pieces on a clean, flat surface. Add 1 tsp. of Nutella to the middle of the croissant piece. Use the spoon to spread the Nutella out into a small square (leaving approximately 1 or 2” from the edge). Place 5 to 8 mini-marshmallows on top of your Nutella square. Cover the square with marshmallows without overwhelming it. Fold croissant piece into a triangle. Make sure none of the Nutella or marshmallows ooze from the sides. If they do, remove some of the filling until you have a comfortable fit. Crimp the edges of the croissant using your fork. Work your way around the folded edges by gently pressing down with the fork tongs to create a crimping pattern. Bake croissants according to package/manufacturer directions. Marshmallows should melt into the Nutella to create a creamy, chocolaty filling.
